skill.name: xlsx
skill.description: Spreadsheet toolkit (.xlsx/.csv). Create/edit with formulas/formatting, analyze data, visualization, recalculate formulas, for spreadsheet processing and analysis.
skill.summary: Spreadsheet toolkit (.xlsx/.csv). Create/edit with formulas/formatting, analyze data, visualization,...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: All 66 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The skill uses subprocess calls only for legitimate LibreOffice operations with hardcoded arguments. Documentation code blocks with backticks are examples, not executable code. References to cryptographic URLs and C2 keywords in documentation are standard content unrelated to actual functionality.

content.value_statement: This skill enables creating, editing, and analyzing Excel spreadsheets with formulas, formatting, and data analysis capabilities. It also recalculates formulas and verifies zero errors for publication-quality outputs.
actual_capabilities: Create new Excel workbooks with formulas, formatting, and styling
Edit existing Excel files while preserving formulas and formatting
Analyze data using pandas for bulk operations and statistics
Recalculate all formulas in a spreadsheet and identify errors
Apply industry-standard color coding for financial models
Export data to and from Excel with proper formatting
limitations: Requires LibreOffice installed for formula recalculation
Does not support Excel features not available in openpyxl (macros, VBA)
Formula recalculation only works with LibreOffice, not Microsoft Excel

use_cases.title: Build financial models
use_cases.description: Create valuation models, budget forecasts, and financial reports with proper formula structure and error checking.

use_cases.title: Process Excel data
use_cases.description: Import, clean, and analyze data from Excel files using pandas for machine learning workflows.

use_cases.title: Format spreadsheets
use_cases.description: Apply consistent formatting, color coding, and styling to improve spreadsheet readability and maintainability.

prompt_templates.title: Create Simple Spreadsheet
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an Excel file named sales_report.xlsx with a summary sheet showing monthly sales totals, formatted with currency and bold headers.

prompt_templates.title: Edit Existing File
prompt_templates.prompt: Update the revenue numbers in budget.xlsx to reflect Q4 actuals. Keep all existing formulas intact.

prompt_templates.title: Recalculate Formulas
prompt_templates.prompt: Recalculate all formulas in model.xlsx and identify any #REF! or #DIV/0! errors with their cell locations.

prompt_templates.title: Build Financial Model
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a DCF valuation model in template.xlsx with assumptions in separate cells, proper color coding, and documented data sources.

output_examples.input: Create a budget spreadsheet with Q1 projections
output: Created budget.xlsx with Summary, Revenue, Expenses, and Assumptions sheets
Applied color coding: blue for inputs, black for formulas, green for links
No formula errors detected after recalculation

best_practices: Always use Excel formulas instead of hardcoding calculated values to maintain spreadsheet recalculation capability
Document data sources for hardcoded values using the format: Source: [Document], [Date], [Reference]
Recalculate formulas after every edit using recalc.py and verify zero errors before finalizing
anti_patterns: Hardcoding calculated values instead of using Excel formulas
Opening files with data_only=True and saving, which permanently removes formulas
Mixing pandas for analysis with openpyxl for the same file without proper save handling

faq.question: What libraries does this skill use?
faq.answer: openpyxl for Excel files with formulas/formatting, pandas for data analysis, and LibreOffice for formula recalculation.

faq.question: How do I recalculate formulas?
faq.answer: Run: python recalc.py <file.xlsx>. The script returns JSON with error locations if any formulas are broken.

faq.question: Does this work with password-protected files?
faq.answer: No. This skill does not support encrypted or password-protected Excel files.

faq.question: Can I edit files with macros?
faq.answer: openpyxl cannot read or write VBA macros. Only use this skill for formula-based Excel files.

faq.question: What Excel errors does recalc.py detect?
faq.answer: It detects #VALUE!, #DIV/0!, #REF!, #NAME?, #NULL!, #NUM!, and #N/A errors with cell locations.

faq.question: How are color codes applied?
faq.answer: Blue (0,0,255) for inputs, black (0,0,0) for formulas, green (0,128,0) for internal links, red (255,0,0) for external links.
